ai.summary: A demanding 16.7 km circuit around the Lady Hervey Walk at Ickworth Estate. It blends lakeside paths, woodland trails, and open parkland, delivering steady climbs and long stretches of scenic views for experienced hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of well-maintained estate tracks, uneven woodland paths, and grassy sections. Surfaces include gravel, dirt, and occasional muddy patches near the lakes, with a few short gradients and exposed sections that can be tricky in wind or rain.
ai.safety_notes: Prepare for a hard hike with significant distance. Check weather and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and bring a waterproof layer. Carry enough water and snacks, plus a map or GPS and a fully charged phone. Stay on marked paths, mind gates and livestock, and be cautious on wet or muddy ground near water. If hiking with dogs, keep them under control and respect wildlife.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with ankle support
Weather-appropriate clothing with a waterproof jacket
Extra pair of socks and lightweight rain cover
